title: Carib (2010) New Testament
description: Carib translation of the New Testament published in 2010 by Wycliffe Bible Translators. Carib or Kari'nja is a Cariban language spoken by the Kalina people of South America. It is spoken by around 7,400 people mostly in Venezuela, Guyana, Suriname, French Guiana, and Brazil.

language.name: Galibi Carib
language.area: Monagas and Anzoategui states, northeast near Orinoco River mouth, a few communities in Bolivar state, just south of Orinoco. Also in Brazil, French Guiana, Guyana, Suriname.
